result.execSummary:
The defendant Amanda Elizabeth Webster was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with: 16CM232

miscConds.notes:
Apply bond on file and balance of $163.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #15CM340.
Balance of $40.93 DNA surcharge to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #15CM340.

-Random and regular testing.
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. 
-Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
-Defendant to seek and maintain employment and higher education.
-Defendant to report to the Day Report Center to provide a DNA sample.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Karl E. Anderson DF ATTY: Shirlene Renee Perrin DF: Amanda Elizabeth Webster appeared. Case called at 9:46. Includes 16CM232, 15CM340, 16CF302. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads  G to 16CM232, 15CM340. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of 16CM232, 15CM340. On motion of the State without objection, Crt dismisses 16CF302. Sentencing arguments. DE makes statement. Crt orders:
On 15CM340 I/S 30 days St. Croix County Jail with huber for employment - Consecutive. 
2 years probation Concurrent to MN probation.

Conditions:
- AODA and follow through
-  Costs of $243.00
- Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge of $200.00.
- Restitution of $10.93.
- Random and regular testing. 
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times . This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-  Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
- DE to seek and maintain employment and higher education. 

On 16CM232 I/S  90 days St. Croix County Jail - Consecutive
2 years probation Concurrent to MN probation and to
15CM340
    Probation is concurrent without prejudice to consecutive sentencing
    in the event of Probation revocation.
-  Costs of $243.00
- Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge of $200.00.

Probation may be transferred to MN.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 9, 2017 at 09:30 am.

ADA Anderson requests a plea and sentencing date. Atty. Perrin agrees. Court amends the bond in 16CM232 to be included in 15CM340. Address confirmed. Bond continues. Per EJL 4/7/17 - Faxed Dispatch and Sheriff.  eif

Bail/bond hearing on April 10, 2017 at 01:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on April 25, 2017 at 03:15 pm.

$250.00 bond on file. Defendant to post $250.00 before release.

I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Day Report Center agreement on today's date. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in an arrest warrant and/or referral for criminal charges.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Richard H.  The term no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
